raw: * Basic application routing manager.
* Define routes to react on certain GET / POST / DELETE / PUT operations.
* * GET is triggered when the hash value of the url is changed. Can be called
*   manually by calling the {@link #executeGet} method.
* * POST / DELETE / PUT has to be triggered manually right now (will be changed later)
*    by calling the {@link #executePost}, {@link #executeDelete}, {@link #executePut} method.
* This manager can also be used to provide browser history.
* *Example*
* Here is a little example of how to use the widget.
* <pre class='javascript'>
*   var r = new qx.application.Routing();
*   // show the start page, when no hash is given or the hash is "#/"
*   r.onGet("/", function(data) {
*     startPage.show();
*   }, this);
*   // whenever the url /address is called show the address book page.
*   r.onGet("/address", function(data) {
*     addressBookPage.show();
*   }, this);
*   // address with the parameter "id"
*   r.onGet("/address/{id}", function(data) {
*     addressPage.show();
*     model.loadAddress(data.params.id);
*   }, this);
*   // Alternative you can use regExp for a route
*   r.onGet(/address\/(.*)/, function(data) {
*     addressPage.show();
*     model.loadAddress(data.params.0);
*   }, this);
*   // make sure that the data is always loaded
*   r.onGet("/address.*", function(data) {
*     if (!model.isLoaded()) {
*       model.loadAddresses();
*   }, this);
*   // update the address
*   r.onPost("/address/{id}", function(data) {
*     model.updateAddress(data.params.id);
*   }, this);
*   // delete the address and navigate back
*   r.onDelete("/address/{id}", function(data) {
*     model.deleteAddress(data.params.id);
*     r.executeGet("/address", {reverse:true});
*   }, this);
*
* This example defines different routes to handle navigation events.
* Note this class must be disposed after use

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Basic application routing manager. Define routes to react on certain GET / POST / DELETE / PUT operations.

  • GET is triggered when the hash value of the url is changed. Can be called manually by calling the {@link #executeGet} method.

  • POST / DELETE / PUT has to be triggered manually right now (will be changed later) by calling the {@link #executePost}, {@link #executeDelete}, {@link #executePut} method. This manager can also be used to provide browser history. Example Here is a little example of how to use the widget.

   var r = new qx.application.Routing();

   r.onGet("/", function(data) {
     startPage.show();
   }, this);

   r.onGet("/address", function(data) {
     addressBookPage.show();
   }, this);

   r.onGet("/address/{id}", function(data) {
     addressPage.show();
     model.loadAddress(data.params.id);
   }, this);

   r.onGet(/address\/(.*)/, function(data) {
     addressPage.show();
     model.loadAddress(data.params.0);
   }, this);

   r.onGet("/address.*", function(data) {
     if (!model.isLoaded()) {
       model.loadAddresses();
     }
   }, this);

   r.onPost("/address/{id}", function(data) {
     model.updateAddress(data.params.id);
   }, this);

   r.onDelete("/address/{id}", function(data) {
     model.deleteAddress(data.params.id);
     r.executeGet("/address", {reverse:true});
   }, this);

This example defines different routes to handle navigation events. Note this class must be disposed after use

raw: * Initialization method used to execute the get route for the currently set history path.
* If no path is set, either the given argument named defaultPath
* or the {@link #DEFAULT_PATH} will be used for initialization.
* @param defaultPath {String?} Optional default path for initialization.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Initialization method used to execute the get route for the currently set history path. If no path is set, either the given argument named defaultPath or the {@link #DEFAULT_PATH} will be used for initialization.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: defaultPath {String?} Optional default path for initialization.
@param.description: Optional default path for initialization.

raw: * Checks if path is valid and registered in channel "get" and then just returns it.
* If the path is not valid either the defaultPath (if given) or the
* {@link #DEFAULT_PATH} will be returned.
* @param path {String} Path which gets checked.
* @param defaultPath {String?} Optional default path.
* @return {String} A valid path.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if path is valid and registered in channel "get" and then just returns it. If the path is not valid either the defaultPath (if given) or the {@link #DEFAULT_PATH} will be returned.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: path {String} Path which gets checked.
@param.description: Path which gets checked.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: defaultPath {String?} Optional default path.
@param.description: Optional default path.

raw: * Adds a route handler for the "get" operation. The route gets called
* when the {@link #executeGet} method found a match.
* @param route {String|RegExp} The route, used for checking if the executed path matches.
* @param handler {Function} The handler to call, when the route matches with the executed path.
* @param scope {Object} The scope of the handler.
* @return {String} Event listener ID

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds a route handler for the "get" operation. The route gets called when the {@link #executeGet} method found a match.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: route {String|RegExp} The route, used for checking if the executed path matches.
@param.description: The route, used for checking if the executed path matches.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: handler {Function} The handler to call, when the route matches with the executed path.
@param.description: The handler to call, when the route matches with the executed path.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: scope {Object} The scope of the handler.
@param.description: The scope of the handler.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: path {String} The path of the entry
@param.description: The path of the entry

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map|null} The retrieved entry. null when no entry was found.
@return.description: The retrieved entry. null when no entry was found.

raw: * Navigates back to the previously executed path.
* @param customData {Map?} The given custom data that should be propagated.
* If it contains a key defaultPath and no history data is
*   available, its value is used as a target path. If it does not include
*   such a key, the routing's default path is used instead (again only for
*   empty history).
*   This behavior is useful for instance when reloading a page during
*   development but expecting the page's back button always to work.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Navigates back to the previously executed path.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: customData {Map?} The given custom data that should be propagated. If it contains a key defaultPath and no history data is available, its value is used as a target path. If it does not include such a key, the routing's default path is used instead (again only for empty history). This behavior is useful for instance when reloading a page during development but expecting the page's back button always to work.
@param.description: The given custom data that should be propagated. If it contains a key defaultPath and no history data is available, its value is used as a target path. If it does not include such a key, the routing's default path is used instead (again only for empty history). This behavior is useful for instance when reloading a page during development but expecting the page's back button always to work.

raw: * Decouples the Routing from the navigation handler.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Decouples the Routing from the navigation handler.
